Bibliographic metadata.Title: Mineral prospectivity mapping of orogenic gold deposits using a mineral systems approach in the Huangling region, western Hubei
Bibliographic metadata.Author: Huimin Wang, Qinglin Xia, Zhou Zhou, Li Lei, Yaqi Meng, Changliang Chen, Yin Gong, Peng Yang

Abstract: The Huangling region hosts the only documented Precambrian gold metallogenic event within the Yangtze craton. This study proposes a mineral systems model for the gold deposits in the Huangling region, comprising four key components: geodynamics, fertility, architecture, and preservation. Geological, geophysical, and geochemical proxies were identified. Predictive modeling using random forests (RF) and convolutional neural networks (CNN) demonstrated superior performance, with the CNN model achieving an area under the curve (AUC) of 0.855. The findings underscore the mineral systems approach as a robust tool for prospectivity mapping of orogenic gold deposits.
Methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > deep learning > convolutional neural network (CNN)

types: Stream sediment geochemical data; Au, Ag, Cu, Pb, Zn, Mo, Sb (units: ppm)
Dataset.scope: Training: Huangling region; Application: Huangling region

Key points: The mineral systems approach effectively identifies key ore-forming processes.
The CNN model outperformed the RF model in predictive accuracy.
Geochemical anomalies were refined using the weighted drainage catchment basin method.
The study identified previously unrecognized high-probability areas for exploration.
